Immuta is the universal cloud data access control platform, enabling data teams to automate data access control on any cloud, using any data platform, at scale. With Immuta, organizations can finally unlock the full value of their data – even the most sensitive data – while improving productivity, reducing time to data, maintaining strong security, and enabling new data sharing use cases. Since our founding in 2015, Immuta has now become the leader in cloud data access control. That comes by applying our expertise in engineering, security, ethics, and law. But, more importantly, it requires a relentless focus on our customers’ needs. Immuta’s customers understand that data is the most critical asset for innovation. Secure, democratized, self-service access to cloud-based data is an imperative to accelerate business intelligence, data science, and data sharing outcomes.  Immuta has been recognized by Forbes as a top American startup employer, by Inc. Magazine as one of the best workplaces, and by Fast Company as one of the top 50 most innovative companies  Customers include Aon, Credit Suisse, Daimler, S&P Global, U.S. Army, and Atlassian. Over half of the top banks now use Immuta Partners include Databricks, Snowflake, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, and Starburst $169 million in total venture capital funding. Investors include Greenspring Associates, March Capital, Ten Eleven Ventures, Intel Capital Corporation, NGP Capital, DFJ Growth, Dell Technologies Capital, Citi Ventures, Inc, Wipro Ventures, and Okta Ventures Major offices in Boston, Massachusetts; Columbus, Ohio; and, College Park, Maryland DATA & ANALYTICS TEAM Immuta’s Data & Analytics team is charged with accelerating Immuta’s impact through data. To enable this, the team delivers novel data products that span the customer lifecycle, and they enable self-service analytics to the entire company through a central data platform. The team is highly collaborative: one month, they might work closely with the Customer Success team to understand customer problem sets, while the next month, they are implementing a scalable product analytics suite. The team is also committed to being an innovation center around the implementation of the Immuta data platform, and to sharing best practices in data governance and operations throughout the organization and beyond. In short, the Data & Analytics team strives to make data at Immuta valuable, trustworthy, and accessible, and to help Immuta’s customers do the same. SENIOR DATA ANALYST The Senior Data Analyst will drive the business forward with insights across multiple functional domains. Develop quantitative analyses to inform business decisions, providing teams with the tools to measure their impact and hold themselves accountable. They will help frame and transform business unknowns into measurable outcomes. They will work tightly with Immuta’s data platform team to ensure that self-service data assets are aligned with business needs, and they will become experts on the platform to deliver high impact data products, including dashboards, presentations and strategic analysis.   YOU WILL: Become a go-to analytics expert on multiple domains at the company- Help bridge the gap between understanding business needs and knowing how to design efficient, usable data models Work across all lines of business to understand and address data needs Help define the data and analytics strategy and technical direction, advocate for best practices, and investigate new technologies Provide mentorship to data consumers across multiple functional areas You are the right fit if you deeply believe that the ability to quickly deliver meaningful analyses built on top of clean, consistent data is a massive competitive advantage and one of the most powerful forms of leverage in business — from improving operational efficiency to informing strategic initiatives.  Our ideal candidate: Can break down complex problems into answerable questions Has 3+ years experience in an analytical role, ideally in a high-growth SaaS company Is nerdy about data and data visualization Has a deep expertise in SQL: aggregation/window/time functions, complex joins/subqueries/CTEs, efficient and reusable views hierarchies/infrastructure Is an expert in at least 1 BI tool such as Looker, Mode, Tableau, or Metabase Can work autonomously and safely on production systems Is able to communicate clearly & concisely with internal and external stakeholders of varying levels of data literacy and expertise TECHNOLOGIES YOU'LL USE: Looker dbt Snowflake Python  Benefits At Immuta, our goal is to help bridge the gap between personal and professional growth, so that our team members can be well and thrive personally and professionally. After all, great professional success stories rarely happen without great personal success stories! Our generous benefits package includes: 100% employer paid Healthcare (Medical, Dental, Vision) premiums and deductibles for you and your dependents (including Domestic Partners) 100% employer paid mental wellness platform for you and your dependents Stock Options Wellness perks (100% employer paid Whoop fitness band and subscription) Paid parental leave (Both Maternity and Paternity) Unlimited Paid time off Learning and Development Resources

Title :  Associate, Data Science Location :  Cincinnati, Ohio Reports to :  Director ENGINE is a media and marketing services company that exists to futureproof clients business. In a fast-changing world, we empower our clients to outperform in the present and win in the future. Driven by data. Fueled by imagination. Powered by technology. Engine is an ecosystem of creative wunderkinds, uber-nerds, business consultants, cultural mavens, and channel specialists working together to help our clients grow. With global headquarters in New York and 16 locations across North America, the UK, Europe, and Asia-Pacific, Engine offers clients a vast range of marketing solutionsincluding insights, content, distribution, data and technology. POSITION SUMMARY: The Associate, Data Science at ENGINE works closely with talented and seasoned researchers and data analyst across a variety of different industries. This is an exciting entry level role that will work closely with our experts for first-hand exposure to the latest business trends, advanced analytics, data engineering and more! This challenging role is designed to hone your research, communication, analytical, and client-development skills, as you work side-by-side with many of todays biggest brands. This role will extend beyond traditional marketing science and incorporate Data Science and Data Engineering skills, to work with both structured and unstructured data sources to provide insights to business-critical decisions. RESPONSIBILITIES: Facilitate the creation and deployment of models, analytical results and business insights in various environments. This includes: Explore and analyze data to uncover patterns and relationships across structured and unstructured data sources. Leverage Python and R packages to transform data as well as create and deploy statistical models. Have an understanding of cloud-based technologies (Microsoft Azure) for data engineering Support the migration of legacy tools to scalable, cloud bases solutions as required Thrive in an innovation rich environment within Data Science as well as Data Operations as a whole Continuously seek opportunities to learn, enhance, and apply analytical skills, such as: Data Manipulation Data Integration Exploratory Data Analysis Statistical Analysis Data Interpretation Learn how to effectively manage the analytical phase of client engagements. This includes: Learning to manage client expectations (internal and external) throughout the project lifecycle. Learn to manage the analytical process and keep scope and pricing in reasonable alignment. Support and participate in client presentations when applicable Work closely with Senior Analysts to provide design and methodology support at the pre-sale phase as well as learn how to provide relevant and concise proposal materials with a point of view on the techniques outlined. This includes: Learning our client's business needs and how to apply analytics across integrated data sources to uncover insights for our clients Learning how to work collaboratively across multiple departments and client facing teams to integrate Data Science capabilities Learn the use and limitations of data from various sources, big data, behavioral data, client data, and how to leverage it to solve client needs. QUALIFICATIONS:  Learn the use and limitations of data from various sources, big data, behavioral data, client data, and how to leverage it to solve client needs. Bachelor’s Degree in STEM, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, Marketing & Analytics is preferred. 6 months to 2 years’ experience in tech-enabled marketing insights environment, in data analysis, market research and methodology Production level programming knowledge; worked with Python, R (Shiny applications a plus), or other machine learning packages Interest and some exposure to a variety of research methodologies, sampling design, data weighting methods, data integration, advanced analytical methods, interactive dashboard/simulators (Shiny) Passion and some knowledge of data analysis, drawing insights relative to Client’s business needs, and communicating insights Proficient in Microsoft Office: Excel, Power Point, Word Familiarity with Tableau is a plus Client centric mindset Believes in and contributes to a positive work environment Proficiency in a selection of modern data analysis tools, such as SPSS, R, Python, SQL Exposure to modern research and predictive methods Passionate about and follows recent advances in Data Science and analysis, including Machine Learning Familiar with and/or desire to learn modern database technologies and their applications Comfortable with learning and applying new technologies and methods Great interpersonal and communication skills Critical thinker and problem solver Some familiarity with structured and unstructured data sources and a desire to learn how to apply them to first party sources to create more value and insight Ability to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical colleagues Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks to meet multiple deadlines Ability to work through complex issues and take all factors large and small into account when making decisions We, ENGINE, are an equal opportunity employer. We strive to promote an organizational environment that values diversity and fosters growth. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other basis prohibited by law. .

Description  Key leadership position responsible for delivering transformational value creation through data science, and data insights that drive the business intelligence strategy for Big Lots. Partners with senior business and technology leaders to define and prioritize business goals, and uses statistical models to answer those questions. Uses a blend of analytic and interpersonal working partnerships to mine data, plan and execute analytical roadmaps, and formulate strategies for driving short-term and long-term business growth. Leads a highly skilled team of data science professionals responsible for compiling and analyzing large sets of data. Drives Big Lots' thought leadership on business intelligence and data analytics practices, standards, and tools. Analyzes and understands the needs of the company and translates data into actionable recommendations.  1. Partners with senior business and technology leaders to identify customer trends, understand business goals, and ultimately develop data-driven business recommendations in alignment with the company's vision and strategy. 2. Translates and delivers customer analytic insights into concrete, actionable recommendations to help shape strategy across the company. Lead innovation that delivers additional business value through utilization of data science and analytics. 3. Builds and maintains relationships with Big Lots leaders to better understand how data science and analytics can best support current and future business needs. Provides guidance and thought leadership on analytical best practices to team members and business partners. 4. Establishes and manages current and long-range objectives, plans, and policies relating to the company's business intelligence and data science capabilities. Leads development of data sciences roadmap throughout the organization. 5. Partners with our IT teams to build requirements for data infrastructure necessary to facilitate efficient analysis and reporting. Ensures data management and data quality controls to ensure accurate calculations. 6. Researches and incorporates emerging technologies and methods to continuously improve analytic capabilities and enhance capacity to provide valuable results. 7. Manages and mentors direct reports including staffing, development, performance, pay, and disciplinary actions as needed. Develops and enhances the skillsets on the team to continue to evolve the maturity of the people, processes, and systems. Provides guidance to other team members as needed. 8. Accountable for the overall integrity and success of the data science team and for ensuring timelines, budgets, and deadlines are met.   Qualifications  1. Masters' Degree in Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Data Mining, or other quantitative field required. PhD preferred. 2. 10+ years of hands-on experience in analytics, data science, business intelligence, or other quantitative disciplines required. 3. Deep understanding of and experience in developing successful analytics-based solutions to business problems required. Proven track record of solving ambiguous and highly complex data problems required. 4. Demonstrated aptitude for strategic thinking and the proven ability to identify and communicate data insights clearly. Able to put ideas and insights into action required. 5. Proficiency using SQL to query large relational databases and ability to build and maintain processes to extract and integrate data from various sources required. Experience writing scripts to manipulate data or automate data pipelines using Python, Ruby, Java, or similar preferred. 6. Experience working with Azure, Snowflake, Hadoop/MapReduce, Spark or other Big Data technologies required. 7. Exceptional critical thinking and attention to detail required. Ability to find balance between deeper exploration and identifying solutions required. Able to make the tough decisions when needed. 8. Strong interpersonal and communication skills required. Able to de-complicate complex technical concepts and tailor messaging to the proper audience required. Able to partner successfully, interact effectively, and influence all corporate levels. 9. Strong business and financial acumen, with strategic focus and experience in effective change management required. Able to translate business objectives into actionable analysis. 10. Strong leadership, coaching, and people development skills to manage a team with a variety of highly technical skillsets and competencies required. Able to guide and motivate cross-functional groups of teams required.  #LI-CC2 We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws.

job_title: Planning Analytics and Risk Management - Data Scientist
job_Description: Planning Analytics and Risk Management - Data Scientist  - (2100804)  US-OH-Fairfield  Description Make a difference with a career in insurance  At The Cincinnati Insurance Companies, we put people first and apply the Golden Rule to our daily operations. To put this into action, we’re looking for extraordinary people to join our talented team. Our service-oriented, ethical, knowledgeable, caring associates are the heart of our vision to be the best company serving independent agents. We help protect families and businesses as they work to prevent or recover from a loss. Share your talents to help us reach for continued success as we bring value to the communities we serve and demonstrate that  Actions Speak Louder in Person ®.  If you’re ready to build productive relationships, collaborate within a diverse team, embrace challenges and develop your skills, then Cincinnati may be the place for you. We offer career opportunities where you can contribute and grow.  Start your journey with us  The Cincinnati Insurance Companies' Planning Analytics and Risk Management department has an open position of Data Scientist – Innovation. This position will be based in our corporate headquarter in Fairfield, Ohio, reporting to the Director of Innovation and Research.  This newly formed innovation analytics team supports our strategic innovation across the company, covering commercial and personal line P&C insurance, reinsurance, and life insurance. The role requires deep analytical thinking and a keen understanding of business processes and the ability to translate data into interactive and dynamic dashboards that are user friendly and reliable. Data Scientist Benefits of this position: Medical Dental 401K PTO Options  Job Duties and Responsibilities Research, design, develop and implement statistical models, AI and advanced machine learning applications to support Clinical Effectiveness Team projects, Pediatric Clinical Care, Research and Informatics leaders. Will work with current data and others with analytical skills to support this endeavor. Develop the documentation and process to identify metrics, targets, weights and resulting clinical integration performance reports for clinical providers. Support the technical team focused on creative use of diverse data sources, such as electronic health record data, insurance claims data, scheduling and financial data, social determinants of health data, and any other relevant sources that help support Clinical Effectiveness, Pediatric Clinical Care, Research, and Health Analytics and Informatics leaders’ strategies. Work with the analytics team to develop new analytic methods and reporting systems to include visual dashboards and other direct-to-provider or direct-to-staff information. Support the analytics team in the creation of analytics and scientific exploration related to value- based care strategies for defining Return on Investment and other financial performance for Clinical Effectiveness, Pediatric Clinical Care and other initiatives across the system of care. In collaboration with information technology, support the architecture of clinical integration approach for disparate data systems including use of data warehouse, external vendor supplied information and any future systems that are needed. Develop analytic models that can be used to identify at-risk patients, predict outcomes, and measure illness severity in critically ill children, and develop methods to share these models with clinicians. Mentor and support the training of new and existing staff in data science and advanced analytics, especially trainees. Maintain fluency in existing and emerging data science technologies and complete online coursework or independent study to fill in gaps of knowledge as needed to manage and execute innovation projects. Contribute to the design and development of databases that help support Clinical Effectiveness, Pediatric Clinical Care, Research, and Informatics Teams’ leader strategies. Oversee the development of novel data pipelines that integrate and normalize large data from a variety of sources (e.g., electronic health record, claims, publicly available data, etc.) to enable visualizations of data that help support Clinical Effectiveness, Pediatric Clinical Care, Research, Health Analytics and Informatics strategies. Collect and maintain Quality Improvement collaborative data for multiple projects across the Rainbow system of care. Position Requirements Master’s degree in math, statistics, computer science, economics, sociology, public health, or related quantitative or social science discipline required; PhD level work in analytics, statistics or related field preferred Preferred experience or working knowledge with complex analytic situations or big data environments. Completion of a Masters or Doctoral degree will fulfill this experience requirement. Preferred experience or working knowledge of with statistics, machine / deep learning (AI) in a healthcare setting. A Masters or Doctoral degree can fulfill this experience requirement. Experience or working knowledge of complex analytic situations or big data environments Experience or working knowledge with statistcis, machine learning/ AI in a healthcare setting This position requires a self-starter who is adept at independent decision-making and is ideally suited for emerging leaders in health data sciences. Extensive experience working with SQL or statistical programming languages (e.g., R, Python) and other data science tools (e.g., Alteryx) to analyze and visualize health care data. Ability to develop data pipelines to support AI and machine learning model development. Ability to learn new software and emerging technologies without extensive hands-on training. Experience in visualization and reporting programs such as Power BI, Tableau, Microstrategy, etc. Expertise is desired working with electronic health record and claims data and fluency working with standardized vocabularies, such as ICD, CPT, LOINC, RxNorm. The work schedule will be hybrid (combination of remote and onsite in Cleveland Ohio). The schedule is typical 8a-5pm (flexible).

The ideal candidate for this role will have blend of Security, Compliance and Data Analytics skills. The Manager brings in a product mindset and leverages agile practices to craft and drive iterations building new Security controls, addressing gaps and incorporate automations to improve efficiency and usability of the technologies. Additionally, the Manager brings in a Service Provider mindset, demonstrate exceptional interpersonal skills, strong leadership, relationship management to build a strong and cohesive team that focuses on security, compliance, and usability Responsibilities: Maintain a comprehensive set of policies, standards, processes, and procedures to achieve compliance across Data Platforms and Analytics Solutions Maintain governance program that ensures security policies, standards and process are being adhered to by new products and Analytics consumers Ensure healthcare information security best practice controls are in place and they adhere to HIPAA utilizing a common control framework (i.e., NIST, HITRUST CSF) Involved in completing security questionnaires and representing the security and privacy of the Data Solutions in a professional manner Serve as liaison to Cardinal Health Enterprise security and audit teams and help influence the policies and processes to be tailored for modern day analytics and self-service analytics Work with the engineering and operations teams to ensure that the infrastructure design meets Cardinal Health, and industry security requirements Monitor security trends for Data lakes, Data Operations, and drive adoption of best practices Conduct risk analysis and advise senior management on appropriate remediation Investigate, drive resolution, and document security incidents Manages expectations with key stakeholders, builds and fosters relationships Participates in the development of policies and procedures to achieve specific goals Leverages understanding of Data Platforms and Analytics Solutions to tailor security policies, standards, and processes, to secure Analytics systems Qualifications: Required Proven information security related work experience. Experience with HIPAA/HITECH regulations and guidelines for securing ePHI data Proficient working in multiple Security domains (e.g., Cryptography, Authentication, Authorization, OWASP, Vulnerability Management, Threat Modeling, Identity Management) Knowledge of Data Platforms and Analytics Solutions and Knowledge in Big Data systems, Data Lakes and Analytics related field managing Build & Run teams Understanding of ML/AI concepts and compliance implications for ML/AL in the industry Aware of common security vulnerabilities like OWASP Top 10 and Ransomware with the ability to successfully communicate the remediation to the business Experience advising and mentoring diverse teams. Preferred Professional certification in the information security space (e.g., CISM, CISSP, CISA, GIAC) or other security certification at a similar level. Familiarity with security frameworks associated with one or more industry standards (e.g., HITRUST CSF, COBIT, COSO, HIPAA/HITECH, ISO, ITIL, NIST, PCI DSS, SOC or SOX) Involvement or knowledge of several aspects related to a SSAE 16 SOC 2 Audit Understanding of protocols underlying security domains (e.g., FIDO, U2F, Web-Auth, SSO, SAML, OAuth Understanding of Data Analytics solutions in Cloud Covid For any onsite, non-remote employees A Covid-19 vaccination is required in order to be employed in this position. job_title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Data Science - Staff - Tech Consulting - Location Open
job_Description: At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. Artificial Intelligence and Data Scientist – Staff - Technology Consulting US EY delivers exceptional services to our clients in the data and analytics domain. We are helping our clients solve their most critical business problems. Our service offerings help our clients apply advanced analytics techniques to drive competitive advantage, use advanced learning algorithms to solve complex business problems, realize the full potential of data through vast amount of disparate data sets available to them, generating insights by capturing data from machines and devise in near real-time. The opportunity You will help our clients navigate the complex world of modern data science and analytics. We’ll look to you to provide our clients with a unique business perspective on how data science and analytics can transform and improve their entire organization – starting with key business issues they face. This is a high growth, high visibility area with plenty of opportunities to enhance your skillset and build your career. Your key responsibilities You’ll spend most of your time working with a wide variety of clients to deliver the latest data science, data analytics, and big data technologies and practices to design, build and maintain scalable and robust solutions that unify, enrich and analyse data from multiple sources. Skills and attributes for success Applying data mining and statistical analysis techniques like hypothesis testing, segmentation and modelling to analyze large amounts of data Helping our clients make data-driven decisions by working with structured and unstructured data sets, building out predictive models and advising our clients on data mining leading practices Building and applying data analysis algorithms (data mining, statistics, machine learning, natural language processing, sentiment analysis, text mining, etc.) as appropriate Designing, architecting and developing solutions leveraging big data technology (Open Source, Hortonworks, AWS or Microsoft) to ingest, process and analyze large, disparate data sets to exceed business requirements Unifying, enriching and analyzing customer data to derive new insights and opportunities Leveraging in-house data platforms as needed and recommending and building new data platforms/solutions as required to exceed business requirements Clearly communicating findings, recommendations and opportunities to improve data systems and solutions Demonstrating deep understanding of and ability to teach data science, concepts, tools, features, functions and benefits of different approaches to apply them Seeking out information to learn about emerging methodologies and technologies Clarifying problems by driving to understand the true issue Looking for opportunities for improving methods and outcomes Applying data driven approach (KPIs) in tying technology solutions to specific business outcomes Collaborating, influencing and building consensus through constructive relationships and effective listening Solving problems by incorporating data into decision making To qualify for the role you must have A bachelor's degree and approximately one year of related work experience; or a related master's At least one year hands-on experience with data science, data analytics, big data, and data engineering Extensive experience connecting to various data sources and structures: APIs, NoSQL, RDBMS, Hadoop, S3, Blob Storage, etc. Deep understanding of statistical modeling as well as SQL, ETL, data ingestion/cleansing and engineering skills Thorough business understanding of data science application and ability to communicate with key decision-makers Hands-on experience with various big data technologies in one or more ecosystems (Hadoop, AWS or Microsoft) Communication is essential, must be able to listen and understand the question and develop and deliver clear insights. Outstanding team player. Independent and able to manage and prioritize workload. Ability to quickly and positively adapt to change. A valid driver’s license in the US; willingness and ability to travel to meet client needs. Ideally, you’ll also have Bachelor’s Degree or above in mathematics, information systems, statistics, computer science, or related disciplines Experience with Azure Data Factory and AzureML a plus Ability to set up data and experimental platforms R or SAS, Python, Java/C# and Scala Machine learning using k-NN, naive bayes, decision trees, SVM experience Experience using data mining and statistical tools Solid pattern recognition and predictive modelling skills Recommendation engines, scoring systems, A/B testing Multiple tools/libraries such as Weka, NumPy, PyMongo, R, etc. What we look for We’re interested in passionate leaders with strong vision and a desire to stay on top of trends in the Data Science and Big Data industry. If you have a genuine passion for helping businesses achieve the full potential of their data, this role is for you. FY22NATDNA What we offer We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. Continuous learning:  You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you:  We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way. Transformative leadership:  We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture:  You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs. If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build. EY | Building a better working world EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets. Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate. Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today. EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, in accordance with applicable law. EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability and either need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during the interview process, please call 1-800-EY-HELP3, type Option 2 (HR-related inquiries) and then type Option 1 (HR Shared Services Center), which will route you to EY’s Talent Shared Services Team or email SSC Customer Support at ssc.customersupport@ey.com.

job_title: Research Statistician - Hatton Institute (Full Time, Days)
job_Description: Attention current TriHealth employees: Please apply for this position by submitting an online internal application via SuccessFactors. Please be certain to update your SuccessFactors Employee Profile prior to applying to this position.  RESEARCH STATISTICIAN This position provides expert consultation and assistance to faculty, fellow and resident physicians in all aspects of completing a research study. This includes research design and protocol development, grant formulation and writing if applicable, data tabulation, statistical analysis, abstract writing and submission, creation of sophisticated poster presentations, and education regarding the research design and statistical analysis utilized in the study. In addition, this position: Manages numerous projects and is accountable for ensuring the appropriate steps are being met to keep the project moving in a timely manner. Coordination of all necessary paperwork to receive Institutional Review Board (IRB) approval, Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) approval, and research funding. Works closely with the program director of their specific area and keeps him/her current on all ongoing staff, resident and fellow research projects. Required to work with a multidisciplinary team and ensures clear and timely communication throughout the study life. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS EDUCATION: Master's Degree in a scientific or technical discipline EXPERIENCE: 1-2 years Professional Clinical Research Experience SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE: Significant and proven clinical research experience including study design and execution. Strong aptitude in statistics is required. Everything we do at TriHealth is with our Team Members in mind and that includes: Supporting our team with training programs Tuition reimbursement Student loan repayment assistance Comprehensive benefits and more.  Working within our award-winning culture means getting the respect and support you need to do your best work ever. Find out why this is the best place to work and be your best!  Apply today . Dana is a global leader in the supply of highly engineered driveline, sealing, and thermal-management technologies that improve the efficiency and performance of vehicles with both conventional and alternative-energy powertrains. Serving three primary markets – passenger vehicle, commercial truck, and off-highway equipment – Dana provides the world's original-equipment manufacturers and the aftermarket with local product and service support through a network of nearly 100 engineering, manufacturing, and distribution facilities.   PURPOSE:    We’re looking for an energetic team member who will help us leverage data relationships to make better decisions for our Aftermarket business.  PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES   Learn and use key aftermarket data to help drive decisions and project prioritizations  Be an aftermarket data resource to the global business. Category management / analytics to support customer data needs  Aftermarket pricing/content data support – reports and process improvements  Learn and use Aftermarket market and product data  Familiarity with Power BI helpful  Gather requirements from key stakeholders and recommend solutions  Lead process improvement projects for content and pricing teams  EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS  Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Pricing, Related Field or equivalent job experience Minimum of 3 year aftermarket experience, preferably with a data management or related role  Willingness to travel up to 10% of the time as needed with the ability to work non-traditional business hours   SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES   Strong analytical and documentation skills  Familiarity with PowerBI  Data management skills  Excellent project management skills  Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills  Effective listener and communicator  Proficient technical skills in Microsoft Office  Demonstrated ability to be proactive and forward thinking  Able to effectively interface with other disciplines in the organization to achieve result  Demonstrated ability to drive results  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

location: Atrium One, 201 East Fourth Street, Suite 1600, Cincinnati, OH 45202
job_Description: We are: We are a leading partner to the world’s major cloud providers. The formation of Accenture Cloud First, with a $3 billion investment over three years, demonstrates our commitment to deliver greater value to our clients when they need it most. Our Cloud First multi-service group of more than 70,000 cloud professionals delivers a full stack of integrated cloud capabilities like data, edge, integrated infrastructure and applications, deep ecosystem skills, culture of change along with pre-configured industry solutions to shape, move, build and operate our clients’ businesses in the cloud. We combine world-class learning and talent development expertise; deep experience in cloud change management; and cloud-ready operating models with a commitment to responsible business by design — with security, data privacy, responsible use of artificial intelligence, sustainability and ethics and compliance built into the fundamental changes Accenture helps companies achieve. You are: As part of our  Data & AI  group, you will lead technology innovation for our clients through robust delivery of world-class solutions. There will never be a typical day and that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference within exciting client initiatives are unlimited in the ever-changing technology landscape. The work: You will be part of a highly collaborative and growing network of technology and data experts, who are taking on today’s biggest, most complex business challenges using the latest data and analytics technologies. We will nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. You will have an opportunity to work in roles such as Cloud Data Engineer, Data Modeler or Data Architect covering all aspects of Data including Data Management, Data Governance and Data Migration. Come grow your career in Technology at Accenture!   What you need: At least 5 years of consulting or client service delivery experience on Azure At least 10 years of experience in big data, database and data warehouse architecture and delivery Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in 2 of the following areas: Solution/technical architecture in the cloud Big Data/analytics/information analysis/database management in the cloud IoT/event-driven/microservices in the cloud Extensive hands-on experience implementing Data and AI platform using Azure Data Services: Serverless Architecture, Azure Storage, Azure SQL DB/DW, Data Factory, Azure Stream Analytics, Azure Analysis Service, HDInsight, Databricks Azure Data Catalog, Cosmo Db, ML Studio, AI/ML, Azure Functions, ARM Templates, Azure DevOps, CI/CD etc. Cloud data migration methodologies and processes including tools like Azure Data Factory, Event Hub, etc. Familiarity with the Technology stack available in the industry for data management, data ingestion, capture, processing and curation: Kafka, StreamSets, Attunity, GoldenGate, Hadoop, Hive, Hbase, Cassandra, Spark, Flume, Hive, Impala, etc. Familiarity with Networking, Windows/Linux virtual machines, Container, Storage, ELB, auto-scaling is a plus Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience (minimum of 12 years), or an Associate degree with a minimum of 6 years of equivalent work experience. Bonus points if you have: Certifications: AZ-303: Microsoft Azure Architect Technologies AZ-304: Microsoft Azure Architect Design DP-200 Implementing an Azure Data Solution DP-201 Designing an Azure Data Solution Implementing DevOps on Azure platform Experience in data governance fields as lineage, quality, catalog etc. Multi-cloud experience As required by the Colorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of minimum compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado  only , the range of starting pay for this role is  $119,880 - $197,900  and  information on benefits offered is here. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.

Description  Job Description: Looking for an opportunity to make an impact? At Leidos, we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customers’ success. We empower our teams, contribute to our communities, and operate sustainable. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business. Your greatest work is ahead! The Civil Environmental & Infrastructure Portfolio at Leidos currently has an opening for an  Environmental Data Analyst/Statistician  in our Oak Ridge, TN, Twinsburg, OH, or Reston, VA office. If this sounds like the kind of environment where you can thrive, keep reading! Primary Responsibilities Include: Preparing and summarizing environmental characterization data and assist in conducting environmental risk assessments and exposure modeling. Preparation of data may include building standardized databases in SAS or SQL Server from varied sources such as text files, Excel, Access, etc. Preparation of data may also include examination of the data to assure completeness and to identify statistical outliers and results that that do not conform to database specifications. Risk assessment activities may include working with risk assessors to select appropriate exposure parameters and receptors for risk models, calculating exposure concentrations, screening environmental concentrations against risk criteria, writing risk assessment summaries, and presenting results to project teams. This individual will work as directed by project teams to query requested data from databases and summarize requested data in tabular and/or graphical formats. The environmental data analyst/statistician may work with statisticians to apply appropriate statistics to estimate sample size requirements and to identify differences between sample populations. Individual must be able to write descriptions of database requirements and of steps taken to prepare and summarize databases. Required Qualifications: Master’s degree in statistics, data management, environmental sciences, toxicology, or a related field and 4+ years progressive experience or a BS degree with 6+ years of experience. Strong data management and programming skills. Experience programming in one or more database languages, preferably SQL, SAS, Python, C#, R, .NET, or Visual Basic and be experienced using Excel, MSWord and Access software. The position requires the ability to communicate technical information orally and in writing. Preferred Qualifications: Experience summarizing environmental characterization data and should understand the appropriate use of statistics for describing statistical distributions and for comparing populations of sample results. Experience developing statistical sampling plans to characterize populations and calculating cleanup goals from environmental exposure assumptions and toxicity data are helpful. Ability to obtain and maintain a DOE security clearance is preferred. Pay Range:

Data Scientist Senior or Lead  Job Number :   182970 Starting your role from the comfort of your home, you’ll be provided office equipment and virtual training. However, as circumstances change, such as the situation with COVID-19 evolves, you will be required to work full-time in our office location when we are ready to open our offices.  As a  Claims Data Scientist , you’ll use machine learning, engineering and languages like Python to develop tools, analyses and applications that solve complex business problems. The problems you’ll solve are wide-ranging and will require a lot of different techniques, including some you’ll probably have to research, learn or create. Final products could range from design of predictive models to more sophisticated visualizations and decision-support tools delivered through user facing web applications you develop.  Must-have qualifications  Master's degree or higher with quantitative focus in Econometrics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science or related field (e.g. Mathematics).  In lieu of the above, Bachelor's degree with quantitative focus in Econometrics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science or related field (e.g. Mathematics) and a minimum of 1 year of relevant experience in Statistical/Quantitative Modeling and/or Machine Learning tools (R, Python, etc.) and in using various database tools (e.g. Hadoop, SQL) processing large volumes of structured and unstructured data.  In lieu of a degree, a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in Statistical/Quantitative Modeling and/or Machine Learning tools (R, Python, etc.) and in using various database tools (e.g. Hadoop, SQL) processing large volumes of structured and unstructured data.   Preferred skills  Proficiency in SQL and one higher level programming language (i.e. Python or R)Ability to communicate technical findings to a wide range of audiences  Experience with tools like Hadoop, AWS, and Linux  Experience developing web applications using popular frameworks (i.e. Flask, Node.JS, Angular and Bootstrap)  Experience with GIT version control system   Compensation  $78,700 - $128,900/year depending on position level and experience Gainshare bonus up to 30% - 40% (depending on position level) of your eligible earnings based on company performance   Benefits  401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to 6% Medical, dental & vision, including free preventative care  Wellness & mental health programs  Health care flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, & life insurance Paid time off  Paid & unpaid sick leave where applicable, as well as short & long-term disability Parental & family leave; military leave & pay  Diverse, inclusive & welcoming culture with Employee Resource Groups  Career development & tuition assistance  Onsite gym & healthcare at large locations   Sponsorship for work authorization for this position is available for candidates who already possess an H-1B visa. Manages the implementation and delivery of information management solutions that support PPO Claims Operations Reporting for Professional, Hospital and Dental claim systems. Will be responsible for the design, implementation and ongoing maintenance of claims-related data sources and processes to allow claims report analysts to exchange consistent and accurate information between the Claims department and its business partners. Leads assignments and activities of analytical reporting staff of professionals. Directs and runs data analysis to achieve strategic goals, recommending improvements to current business reporting structures and/or operations to improve performance Works with the Director to develop and implement control report and Visio workflows that ensure all control objectives are obtained. Handles the generation of queries using Business Objects/Cognos, ACL and Access to support exception reduction initiative as well as other departmental & corporate projects Runs the development of monthly, quarterly and annual Executive summaries, detailing performance, initiatives and overall departmental progress. Validates and analyzes Corporate Executive reports, prior to distribution to Senior Leadership. Maintains the Claims component of the Corporate Data Warehouse to ensure that it is always a current, accurate, and comprehensive source of Claims information available to analysts throughout the PPO community Evaluates information needs and implement appropriate database search mechanisms against a multi-dimensional data warehouse and other electronic sources of patient, provider, and medical data Assists business partners in the identification and interpretation of Claims related information residing in the corporate data warehouse. Coordinates the authoring of documentation for all packaged reports and software applications developed in-house Identifies and proposes short term goals and participate in the long term evolvement of the Claims Reporting unit; assists in the development of internal and external workflows that involve handling routine data analysis requests Works in conjunction with BTS and IT in matters relating to Professional & Facility system reporting. Partner with these support areas in developing criteria to support request from Attorney General, Actuarial and Finance. Ability to prioritize and work on multiple projects simultaneously Effective communication of technical IT-related concepts to individuals with non-technical backgrounds Ability to motivate team members in a stressful environment Strong analytical skills Resourcefulness and creativity under tight deadlines Minimum four years experience in a health care environment or eight years experience in the role of Senior Systems Analyst/Programmer in a health care environment with a background in claims processing procedures Proficiency in relational database concepts and the use of Structured Query Language (SQL) Expertise in using the data manipulation and reporting functionality of common information management software including Infomaker, Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel, Cognos Impromptu and Query, and Crystal Reports Cognizant will only consider applicants for this position whom are legally authorized to work in the United States without requiring company sponsorship now or at any time in the future. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. What you need: Minimum of 3 years of consulting or client service delivery experience on Azure Minimum of 3 years of experience in developing data ingestion, data processing and analytical pipelines for big data, relational databases, NoSQL and data warehouse solutions Extensive hands-on experience implementing data engineering using Azure services: ADLS, Azure Data Factory, Azure Functions, Synapse/DW, Azure SQL DB, Event Hub, IOT Hub, Azure Stream Analytics, Azure Analysis Service, HDInsight, Databricks Azure Data Catalog, Cosmo Db, ML Studio, AI/ML, etc. Minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in Azure and Big Data technologies such as Powershell, C#, Java, Node.js, Python, SQL, ADLS/Blob, Spark/SparkSQL, Databricks, Hive and streaming technologies such as Kafka, EventHub, NiFI etc. Cloud data ingestion and engineering using tools like Azure Data Factory, Data Migration Service, SSIS, Attunity (Qlik), Event Hub, Kafka, etc. Extensive experience providing practical direction within the Azure Native data services and Hadoop Experience in using Big Data File Formats and compression techniques Experience working with Developer tools such as Azure DevOps, Visual Studio Team Server, GitLabs, Jenkins, etc. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience (minimum of 12 years), or an Associate degree with a minimum of 6 years of equivalent work experience Bonus points if you have: Azure Certifications DP-200 Implementing an Azure Data Solution DP-201 Designing an Azure Data Solution AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps SolutionsE Implementing DevOps on Azure platform.
